citing_paper_authors: Joakim, Nivre
raw_text: This technique, first proposed by Sagae and Lavie (2006), was used in the highest scoring system in both the multilingual track (Hall et al, 2007a) and the domain adaptation track (Sagae and Tsujii, 2007)
clean_text: This technique, first proposed by Sagae and Lavie (2006), was used in the highest scoring system in both the multilingual track (Hall et al, 2007a) and the domain adaptation track (Sagae and Tsujii, 2007).

citing_paper_authors: Joakim, Nivre
raw_text: The best performing (closed class) system in the domain adaptation track used a combination of co learning and active learning by training two different parsers on the labeled training data, parsing the unlabeled domain data with both parsers, and adding parsed sentences to the training data only if the two parsers agreed on their analysis (Sagae and Tsujii, 2007)
clean_text: The best performing (closed class) system in the domain adaptation track used a combination of co-learning and active learning by training two different parsers on the labeled training data, parsing the unlabeled domain data with both parsers, and adding parsed sentences to the training data only if the two parsers agreed on their analysis (Sagae and Tsujii, 2007).
